original: ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma yin te ;
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not cognized in that way.

original: ci ste 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de lta na yang gzhan du rtogs pa de gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de lta na yang gzhan du rtogs pa de gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it were cognized as having the nature of an existent, that which is cognized as one thing would not arise as another.

original: gal te spyi rtog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi rtog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is cognized,

original: spyi rtogs pa na khyad par thob par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa na khyad par thob par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could the particular be obtained from the cognition of the universal?

original: yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it exists.

original: 'di ltar spyi ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nyid dngos po med na ni mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na / 'o na ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nyid dngos po med na ni mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, since the universal would not be a non-entity,

original: de nyid las yod pa nyid thob pa'i phyir spyis ci bya /
analyzed: de nyid las yod pa nyid thob pa'i phyir spyis ci bya /
translated: what use is the universal, since the sign, such as smoke, is obtained from it alone, because it does not occur when there is non-existence?

original: spyi rtogs pa med na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa med na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: If the universal is not cognized, how does one engage in it?

original: rtags rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One engages in it through the cognition of the sign.

original: gzhan rtogs pas gzhan la 'jug par mi ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pas gzhan la 'jug par mi ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that one engages in one thing through the cognition of another,

original: spyi yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir nyes pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: spyi yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir nyes pa mtshungs so //
translated: the universal is also different, so the fault is the same.

original: gal te spyi ni gzhan kho nar gcig tu nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi ni gzhan kho nar gcig tu nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a universal is not ascertained as one in relation to others,

original: gal te de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: don gyi spyi ni bzung ba na //
analyzed: don gyi spyi ni bzung ba na //
translated: when the universal of an object is apprehended,

original: don de nyid ni gzung bar 'gyur //üîΩde lta yin dang the tshom ni //
analyzed: don de nyid ni gzung bar 'gyur // de lta yin dang the tshom ni //
translated: that very object would be apprehended.üîΩIf that were so, then

original: med 'gyur bzung la de ji ltar //
analyzed: med 'gyur bzung la de ji ltar //
translated: doubt would not exist, since it is apprehended.

original: spyi'i tshul gyis bzung ba yin gyi bye brag gi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩkhyad par gyi rang @221a * //
analyzed: spyi'i tshul gyis bzung ba yin gyi bye brag gi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhe na / khyad par gyi rang @221a * //
translated: If you say that it is apprehended by way of a universal, but not by way of an individual,

original: bzhin la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: then how could it engage the nature of a particular?

original: de yang bzung ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang bzung ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is apprehended by that as well,

original: ci'i don du 'jug par byed /
analyzed: ci'i don du 'jug par byed /
translated: then for what purpose does it engage?

original: thob pa'i don du'o zhe na /
analyzed: thob pa'i don du'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it engages for the sake of obtaining it,

original: thob pa de yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: thob pa de yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na yin na /
translated: then if that obtaining is the mere realization of its own nature,

original: gal te de yang skyes par 'gyur na 'jug pa la don ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te de yang skyes par 'gyur na 'jug pa la don ci zhig yod /
translated: then if it is generated, what is the point of engaging?

original: tshul 'ga' zhig gis ni rtogs la tshul 'ga' zhig gis ni ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: tshul 'ga' zhig gis ni rtogs la tshul 'ga' zhig gis ni ma rtogs she na /
translated: If you say that it is realized by some mode and not realized by some mode,

original: tshul gang gis rtogs pa'i tshul de nas ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul gang gis rtogs pa'i tshul de nas ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: then the mode by which it is realized is not the mode by which it engages.

original: don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is meaningless.

original: gang gis ma rtogs pa de nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis ma rtogs pa de nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it from that which is not understood,

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible.

original: shes pa la ni the tshom mi za la /
analyzed: shes pa la ni the tshom mi za la /
translated: There is no doubt about knowledge,

original: ma shes pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma shes pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is there about what is not known,

original: the tshom ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin la reg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin la reg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because doubt touches both natures.

original: gal te spyi dang khyad par dag ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir khyad par la ma rtogs kyang 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi dang khyad par dag ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir khyad par la ma rtogs kyang 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that one engages in a particular because of the identity of the nature of the universal and the particular,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: yul du ma byas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul du ma byas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is not an object.

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa ni gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes kyang bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa ni gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes kyang bstan zin to //
translated: It has also been shown that what is understood and what is not understood are not the same.

original: shes pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur gyi ma shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur gyi ma shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One understands a single cognition, but not what is not known.

original: 'on te yang dus gzhan du shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang dus gzhan du shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that it is known at another time,

original: dus gzhan la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: dus gzhan la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: it has been shown that at another time there is neither direct perception nor inference.

original: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But, if impermanence and so on are not the nature of all things,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can they be inferred?

original: tha snyad du bya ba nyid du'o snyam na /
analyzed: tha snyad du bya ba nyid du'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that they are, in terms of conventional expressions,

original: tha snyad kyi bdag nyid nges pa de nyid ci ste med ce na /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bdag nyid nges pa de nyid ci ste med ce na /
translated: why is the nature of conventional expressions not ascertained?

original: 'di ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lan ma yin te /
translated: This is not an answer.

original: 'di ltar / 'dra ba gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dra ba gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because another similar one exists,

original: la lar yongs su mi shes te //
analyzed: la lar yongs su mi shes te //
translated: in some cases, it is not fully understood.

original: 'khrul phyir sgong gi tha dad bzhin //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir sgong gi tha dad bzhin //
translated: Because of error, like the difference between eggs,

original: tha dad mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: because the difference is not seen.

original: sgong la tha dad par ma rtogs pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgong la tha dad par ma rtogs pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not that the difference between eggs is not understood.

original: 'on kyang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: However, because they are similar,

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes de las gzhan du rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i tha snyad med pa yin na //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes de las gzhan du rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i tha snyad med pa yin na //
translated: because of the understanding that ‚Äúthis is just that,‚Äù the convention of difference does not exist.

original: gal te de nyid 'di'o snyam du rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'di'o snyam du rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if the understanding ‚Äúthis is just that‚Äù is erroneous,

original: mthong ba ma 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba ma 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: is the seeing not nonerroneous?

original: ji ltar tha dad pa ma rtogs /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa ma rtogs /
translated: How is the difference not understood?

original: ci ste bsgribs pa'i phyir rtogs su zin kyang 'bras bu las ma rtogs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bsgribs pa'i phyir rtogs su zin kyang 'bras bu las ma rtogs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even though it is known, it is not known from the effect because it is obscured,

original: bsgribs pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgribs pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then that which is called ‚Äúobscured‚Äù does not exist.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa dang / ma rig pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa dang / ma rig pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because awareness and non-awareness are mutually exclusive.

original: yang na gnyig phan tshun du bsgribs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gnyig phan tshun du bsgribs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, both would obscure each other.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive,

original: gal te bsgribs pa nyid yin na //üîΩphan tshun spangs te gnas par ni //
analyzed: gal te bsgribs pa nyid yin na // phan tshun spangs te gnas par ni //
translated: if it is obscured,üîΩthen because they are mutually exclusive,

original: mtshungs phyir gnyi ga bsgribs par @221b 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshungs phyir gnyi ga bsgribs par @221b 'gyur //
translated: both would be obscured.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba sgrib par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du nyams su myong ba yang rnam par rtog pa sgrib par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i nyams su myong ba las tha dad pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba sgrib par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du nyams su myong ba yang rnam par rtog pa sgrib par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as conceptualization is obscured by experience because it is different from the experience of one‚Äôs own essence, in the same way, experience would also obscure conceptualization.

original: 'on te sems gcig la chags pa la blo tha dad pa nyid mi skye ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sems gcig la chags pa la blo tha dad pa nyid mi skye ba yin na /
translated: But if it is the case that the mind is attached to one thing, and a different cognition does not arise,

original: de lta na nyams su myong ba nyid med pa'i phyir de la gags byas pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na nyams su myong ba nyid med pa'i phyir de la gags byas pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: then, since there is no experience, what is the point of saying that it is obstructed?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sngar gyi tha dad dngos po de //
analyzed: sngar gyi tha dad dngos po de //
translated: The previous different thingsüîΩare seen as not destroyed,

original: zhig phyir mthong ba med pa dang // rtag par lhag par zhen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhig phyir mthong ba med pa dang // rtag par lhag par zhen pa'i phyir //
translated: because of the attachment to permanence,

original: rtag pa nyid du sems pa yin //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du sems pa yin //
translated: the mind thinks that they are permanent.

original: sngar gyi dngos po dang mthong ba yang 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi dngos po dang mthong ba yang 'das pa yin te /
translated: The previous things and the seeing are past.

original: de ni da ltar tha snyad du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de ni da ltar tha snyad du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: They are only spoken of as existing in the present.

original: tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du byed do //
translated: They are also made permanent by convention.

original: des na mthong ba 'das pa des 'di ji ltar sgrib par byed /
analyzed: des na mthong ba 'das pa des 'di ji ltar sgrib par byed /
translated: So how can that past seeing obstruct this one?

original: phyin ci log tu nges pa'i ni de'i tshe yod pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu nges pa'i ni de'i tshe yod pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is determined in error exists at that time.

original: des na 'jig rten de nyid kyi tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten de nyid kyi tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the world makes conventions about reality.

original: des na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de bsgribs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de bsgribs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the very fact that there is no conventional expression in accordance with that is the obscuration.

original: tha dad pa gzhan nye bar mi mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan nye bar mi mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not indicate a difference that is other.

original: de'i phyir sgong bzhin du skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa tha dad pa nye bar mi mtshon pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgong bzhin du skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa tha dad pa nye bar mi mtshon pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Therefore, just as with an egg, since a second moment and so on are not indicated as different, one conventionally says, ‚ÄúThat very thing is this.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rtags med byis par gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags med byis par gyis //
translated: As such, one should understand that it is without a sign.

original: skye bos phyis 'byung ba dang ni //
analyzed: skye bos phyis 'byung ba dang ni //
translated: Later, by beingsüîΩand by a lamp and so on,

original: 'brel med mar me la sogs kyis //
analyzed: 'brel med mar me la sogs kyis //
translated: which are unrelated,

original: 'jig pa mthong bas yongs gcod nyid //
analyzed: 'jig pa mthong bas yongs gcod nyid //
translated: destruction is seen.

original: gal te sgong la sogs pa'i tha dad par ni zhib mo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir gzung ba kho na yin gyi skad cig ma nyid ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgong la sogs pa'i tha dad par ni zhib mo dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir gzung ba kho na yin gyi skad cig ma nyid ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because the difference of an egg and so on is grasped by the subtle, it is apprehended, but the momentariness is not like that,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is also not correct.

original: 'di ltar / de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa dang 'jig pa dang mi rtag pa zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa dang 'jig pa dang mi rtag pa zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it is conventionally said that it is not in that state, it is destroyed, and it is impermanent.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa ni de'i skabs ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa ni de'i skabs ma yin gyi /
translated: The lamp, etc., are not the occasion of the arising of the flame, etc.

original: 'on kyang til mar gzhan dang gzhan gyis bskyed pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang til mar gzhan dang gzhan gyis bskyed pa na /
translated: But when the lamp, etc., are produced by other and other sesame oil, etc.,

original: sgron ma gzhan dang gzhan 'bar ba yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma gzhan dang gzhan 'bar ba yin no //
translated: other and other flames arise.

original: de lta mod kyi 'dra ba 'am tshogs mtshungs pa las de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad ni byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'dra ba 'am tshogs mtshungs pa las de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad ni byed pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the convention ‚Äúthat very one‚Äù is not made on the basis of similarity or a similar collection.

original: gal te mar me 'bar ba'i bkod pa 'di ni gcig nyid kyi tshe til mar gyis bskyed pa gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mar me 'bar ba'i bkod pa 'di ni gcig nyid kyi tshe til mar gyis bskyed pa gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If the arrangement of the burning lamp is the same one when the sesame oil produces only one flame,

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also not correct.üîΩThus:üîΩIf that is the mere collection

original: 'di ltar / gal te de ni dang po yi //üîΩtshogs pa tsam du dus gzhan du //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te de ni dang po yi // tshogs pa tsam du dus gzhan du //
translated: at the beginning,

original: gnas par skyes na de las gzhan //
analyzed: gnas par skyes na de las gzhan //
translated: then it would remain at another time,

original: til sogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
analyzed: til sogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur //
translated: and sesame, etc., would be without result.

original: til la sogs pa'i tshegs pa dang po tsam las dus kyi tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa sgron ma la sogs pa skye na de la gzhan sgong bu dang / @222a * //
analyzed: til la sogs pa'i tshegs pa dang po tsam las dus kyi tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa sgron ma la sogs pa skye na de la gzhan sgong bu dang / @222a * //
translated: If the lamp, etc., arise from the mere collection of sesame, etc., at the beginning, then it would pervade the entire collection at all times, and the other, the sesame, etc., would be without result.

original: ras bal dang / til mar dang / me dang sbyor ba'i tshogs pa rnams don cung zad rgyas par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ras bal dang / til mar dang / me dang sbyor ba'i tshogs pa rnams don cung zad rgyas par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The collection of cotton, oil, and fire does not produce a slightly greater effect.

original: grub zin pas na gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub zin pas na gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already established, it is not dependent on another.

original: ci ste skyes zin kyang dus gzhan du khyab pa nyid ni til la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste skyes zin kyang dus gzhan du khyab pa nyid ni til la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: But if you think that even though it is already produced, it is pervaded by another time, and it is only oil that is produced from sesame seeds,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: not anything else, then that is not so.

original: dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid du skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid du skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already produced as something that endures for another time.

original: dus gzhan du mi gnas pa yin na ni til mar la sogs pa'i tshogs pas phyis cung zad kyang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du mi gnas pa yin na ni til mar la sogs pa'i tshogs pas phyis cung zad kyang bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not endure for another time, then the collection of sesame seeds and so on would be pointless, because later it would not be able to produce anything at all.

original: gzhan skyed na ni de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan skyed na ni de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: If it produces another, then it is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du gal te skyes pa de bdag nyid thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te skyes pa de bdag nyid thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin na ni /
translated: In the same way, if that which is produced is apprehended in all its aspects,

original: mig la sogs pas de'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa don med pa kho na'o //üîΩ'on te mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan dag gam /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas de'i bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa don med pa kho na'o // 'on te mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan dag gam /
translated: because the eye, etc. would apprehend all of its nature.üîΩIf you say that it is apprehended by another seeing,

original: dus gzhan du gnas pa'i 'dzin pas dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas pa'i 'dzin pas dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: or by an apprehending that exists at another time,

original: de ltar gyur na mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan dag rnam par chad pa'i phyir gcig gis kyang dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan dag rnam par chad pa'i phyir gcig gis kyang dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because the other seeings are separate, none of them would apprehend the existence at another time.

original: 'dzin pa dus gzhan du gnas pa can nyid yin na ni cig car kho na de ltar bzung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa don med pa zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dus gzhan du gnas pa can nyid yin na ni cig car kho na de ltar bzung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa don med pa zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the apprehending that exists at another time that apprehends it, then the eye, etc. would be useless for the apprehension, because it would be apprehended just by that existing at another time.

original: de'i phyir mthong bas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo cung zad kyang ma bzung ba'i phyir skad cig tsam kho na snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong bas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo cung zad kyang ma bzung ba'i phyir skad cig tsam kho na snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the seeing does not apprehend the slightest thing that is the nature of the prior or subsequent, it appears as just an instant.

original: ci ste yang snga phyi dang bral ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid yun ring por 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang snga phyi dang bral ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid yun ring por 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the nature of a thing, which is devoid of prior and subsequent parts, endures for a long time,

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩcig car mthong yun ring gi dus //
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / cig car mthong yun ring gi dus //
translated: that is not tenable.üîΩIf it is seen at one time, it is seen for a long time.

original: yun ring dus ni cig car nyid //
analyzed: yun ring dus ni cig car nyid //
translated: If it is seen for a long time, it is seen at one time.

original: mthong na thams cad de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong na thams cad de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: If it is seen in this way, everything is like that.

original: mthong ba rjes 'jug kho na yis //
analyzed: mthong ba rjes 'jug kho na yis //
translated: It is only by the succession of seeing

original: dus ring rtogs par byed pa yin //
analyzed: dus ring rtogs par byed pa yin //
translated: that a long time is cognized.

original: ji lta ji ltar mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan rgyun du skye ba de lta de ltar ring por rtogs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩdus gcig nyid du rtogs pa ni dus ring po nyid kyis ring po ma yin te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan rgyun du skye ba de lta de ltar ring por rtogs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // dus gcig nyid du rtogs pa ni dus ring po nyid kyis ring po ma yin te /
translated: Just as a long time is cognized by the succession of seeing, which is the arising of one seeing after another, it is not cognized in any other way.üîΩThe cognition of a long time at one time is not a long time.

original: dus ring por cig car du ni rigs pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus ring por cig car du ni rigs pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of a long time at one time is not a long time.

original: mthong ba ni skad cig nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni skad cig nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Seeing is what causes the cognition of a moment.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis rang gi ngo bor gyur pa skad cig ma nyid du yongs su bcad na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis rang gi ngo bor gyur pa skad cig ma nyid du yongs su bcad na /
translated: If direct perception determines the momentariness of a thing that has become its own nature,

original: yongs su bcad pa la yang rmongs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa la yang rmongs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be confusion about the determination?

original: 'di la 'di skad brjod de /üîΩnus pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: 'di la 'di skad brjod de / nus pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
translated: This is said:

original: gyur kyang de ma thag med pas //
analyzed: gyur kyang de ma thag med pas //
translated: Even if the capacity were the nature of a thing,üîΩbecause it is not immediately perceived,

original: 'bras bu mthong @222b pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong @222b pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: the result is not seen,

original: rmongs 'gyur nges gsal med phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs 'gyur nges gsal med phyir ro //
translated: so there is confusion because of the absence of certainty.

original: dper na 'bras bu de ma thag tu ma mthong ba dag gis nus pa yongs su bcad kyang nges par mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu de ma thag tu ma mthong ba dag gis nus pa yongs su bcad kyang nges par mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if the capacity is determined by not immediately seeing the result, it does not necessarily produce it.

original: de nyid bzlog pa'i ched du ni //
analyzed: de nyid bzlog pa'i ched du ni //
translated: For the sake of countering just that,

original: rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin //
translated: inference is stated.

original: blo gros chen pos mthong nyid pas //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos mthong nyid pas //
translated: Because of the great intellect's seeing,

original: rnam pa thams cad nges par byed //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad nges par byed //
translated: all aspects are ascertained.

original: goms pa dang bral ba rnams dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad mthong na yang rmongs pa des na nges pa med do //
analyzed: goms pa dang bral ba rnams dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad mthong na yang rmongs pa des na nges pa med do //
translated: Even when those who are not familiar see all aspects of a thing, because of that confusion, there is no certainty.

original: de'i phyir rmongs pa bzlog pa'i ched du rjes su dpag pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmongs pa bzlog pa'i ched du rjes su dpag pa 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of countering confusion, inference engages.

original: gang dag la goms pa gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa /
analyzed: gang dag la goms pa gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa /
translated: Those who have a cause for ascertaining clarity, etc.,

original: blo chen po can gyi rgyud de dag ni mthong ba nyid las nges pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: blo chen po can gyi rgyud de dag ni mthong ba nyid las nges pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: in their continuum, which is a great mind, will have certainty just from seeing.

original: des na gang la rmongs pa med pa der ni spyi'i rten grub na spyi'i grub pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: des na gang la rmongs pa med pa der ni spyi'i rten grub na spyi'i grub pa kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, when the basis of the universal is established, the universal is established, and there is no confusion about it.

original: gang la rmongs pa yod pa der ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa na'o //üîΩ'o na ni dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang chos du ma nyid du rnam par 'jog par ci ltar 'gyur te sngon po nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i ser po'i rang bzhin
analyzed: gang la rmongs pa yod pa der ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa na'o // 'o na ni dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang chos du ma nyid du rnam par 'jog par ci ltar 'gyur te sngon po nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i ser po'i rang bzhin
translated: When there is confusion about it, it is inference.

original: du nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is one thing, how could the conceptual consciousness that follows after it posit many things, since the conceptual consciousness that follows after the experience of blue does not ascertain the nature of yellow?

original: 'di la lan du /üîΩthams cad la ni ldog pa yis //
analyzed: 'di la lan du / thams cad la ni ldog pa yis //
translated: The answer to that is this:üîΩThe meaning of all is not different

original: tha dad med don de la ni //
analyzed: tha dad med don de la ni //
translated: from the meaning of the exclusion.

original: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can blo dang // ji ltar brdar btags pa yi sgra //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can blo dang // ji ltar brdar btags pa yi sgra //
translated: and the word is applied by convention.

original: tha dad rten can bzhin 'jug 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad rten can bzhin 'jug 'gyur //
translated: They are applied as if they had a different basis.

original: 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni //
analyzed: 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni //
translated: If there is no cause for error,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rang dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rang dang ni //
translated: then by its very nature

original: rjes su mthun pa'i blo skyed byed //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i blo skyed byed //
translated: it produces a cognition that is in conformity with it.

original: skye ba can gyi 'gro ba thams cad ni rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa las ldog pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba can gyi 'gro ba thams cad ni rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa las ldog pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: All beings that are born are based on a distinction between what is of the same kind and what is of a different kind.

original: de dag ni gang dang gang las ldog pa de dang de las tha dad pa ldog pa'i mtshams tha dad par nye bar btags pa /
analyzed: de dag ni gang dang gang las ldog pa de dang de las tha dad pa ldog pa'i mtshams tha dad par nye bar btags pa /
translated: They are designated as having a different basis of distinction from whatever they are distinguished.

original: de dang de la brten nas chos tha dad par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de dang de la brten nas chos tha dad par rtogs par byed do //
translated: Based on that, they are understood to be a different entity.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa can yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa can yin na /
translated: If they are distinguished from all entities,

original: ji ltar dus gcig nyid du ldog pa thams cad mi nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dus gcig nyid du ldog pa thams cad mi nges she na /
translated: how is it that all distinctions are not ascertained at the same time?

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that it is because there is a cause for error.

original: sngar mthong ba brjed pa'i phyir te sngar mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin yul du byed na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar / nyams myong ji lta ba bzhin du //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba brjed pa'i phyir te sngar mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin yul du byed na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / nyams myong ji lta ba bzhin du //
translated: because it forgets what it has seen previously, for if it were to take as its object what it has seen previously, it would not be certain that it has ceased.üîΩThus:

original: dran sogs nges yin gzhan du ni //
analyzed: dran sogs nges yin gzhan du ni //
translated: Memory, etc., are certain in accordance with experience, otherwise

original: gcig tu nges pa'i phyin ci log / gnyis kar nges med the tshom yin //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i phyin ci log / gnyis kar nges med the tshom yin //
translated: there would be error, certainty, or doubt.

original: nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du dran na ni nges pa med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du dran na ni nges pa med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If memory is in accordance with experience, it is not uncertain.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa gang yin pa de nyid nges pa yin no //üîΩji lta ba @223a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa gang yin pa de nyid nges pa yin no // ji lta ba @223a * //
translated: That which is memory in accordance with what was seen is certainty.

original: bzhin du dran pa yang goms pa las yin te /
analyzed: bzhin du dran pa yang goms pa las yin te /
translated: Memory in accordance with what was seen arises from habituation.

original: des na goms pa dang ldan pa rnams ni mthong ba'i de ma thag kho nar nges par byed la /
analyzed: des na goms pa dang ldan pa rnams ni mthong ba'i de ma thag kho nar nges par byed la /
translated: Thus, those who are habituated ascertain it immediately upon seeing it.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi dran pa bzlog pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi dran pa bzlog pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be inference, because it is memory of what was not seen.

original: gzhan dag smra ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag smra ba ni /
translated: Others say:

original: yang na 'dir yang mi dmigs pa'i ;
analyzed: yang na 'dir yang mi dmigs pa'i ;
translated: Or, in this context, it is the nonobservation of that.üîΩ

original: / rtags las 'jig pa 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: / rtags las 'jig pa 'grub pa yin //
translated: Or else, here too, destruction is established from the logical mark of non-apprehension.

original: dngos po thams cad ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
translated: All entities are related to origination and destruction.

original: skye ba ni mngon sum dang yod pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni mngon sum dang yod pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Origination is established by direct perception and by inference that proves existence.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas /
translated: Destruction is a non-entity.

original: de ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is established by non-apprehension.

original: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pas dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pas dgag pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since all negations are established by non-apprehension, there is no other means of establishing a negation.

original: gal te mi rtag pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid yin pas yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid yin pas yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If impermanence is the intrinsic nature of entities, is it not understood by the valid cognition that establishes existence?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Impermanence is not just the intrinsic nature itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sngar byung dngos po med gyur pa //
analyzed: sngar byung dngos po med gyur pa //
translated: The non-existence of a previously existent thing

original: mi rtag ces ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: mi rtag ces ni brjod pa yin //
translated: is what is called ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: byung ba med pa gang yin pa de mi rtag pa yin gyi byung ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byung ba med pa gang yin pa de mi rtag pa yin gyi byung ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That which does not exist is impermanent, not just anything that exists.

original: dngos po med pa de ni 'dir yang mi dmigs pas sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de ni 'dir yang mi dmigs pas sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The non-existence of a thing is established here by non-apprehension.

original: gal te rgol ba gzhan gyi ltar na mtha' gnyis chod pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgol ba gzhan gyi ltar na mtha' gnyis chod pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If, according to the opponent, impermanence is the existence that is devoid of the two extremes, then it is not the characteristic of non-existence.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis kyi mtha' nyid dang / yod pa nyid ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis kyi mtha' nyid dang / yod pa nyid ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: The non-existence of the two extremes of the prior limit and the posterior limit is not established by non-apprehension.

original: des na 'di ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar zhe na /
translated: So how is this so?

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:üîΩIf impermanence is the existence

original: gang gis mtha' gnyis chod yod pa'am //üîΩ'brel pa brjod pa'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gang gis mtha' gnyis chod yod pa'am // 'brel pa brjod pa'i ngang tshul can //
translated: that is devoid of the two extremes,üîΩand the word ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù

original: mi rtag nyid kyi sgra yin pa //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid kyi sgra yin pa //
translated: has the character of expressing a connection,

original: des mtha' de dag gang la brjod //
analyzed: des mtha' de dag gang la brjod //
translated: to what does it refer?

original: re zhig yod pa tsam ni mi rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa tsam ni mi rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: To begin with, mere existence is not impermanent.

original: bdag la sogs pa yang mi rtag par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa yang mi rtag par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the self and so on would be impermanent.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par med par ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par med par ro //
translated: And there is no difference between form, feeling, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod pa mthar gyur pa gnyis kyi dbus su gnas pa ni khyad par med par mi rtag par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod pa mthar gyur pa gnyis kyi dbus su gnas pa ni khyad par med par mi rtag par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The existence of form, feeling, etc., which is situated between the two extremes, should be described as impermanent, without distinction.

original: dngos po med pa ma rtogs ni med na ni mtha' gnyis nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma rtogs ni med na ni mtha' gnyis nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If nonexistence is not understood, then the two extremes do not exist at all.

original: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa yin na ni dngos po med pa de mi dmigs pas gzung ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa yin na ni dngos po med pa de mi dmigs pas gzung ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is related to nonexistence, then that nonexistence is apprehended by the nonapprehension of that thing, and not otherwise.

original: gal te snga @223b phyir med yin na //
analyzed: gal te snga @223b phyir med yin na //
translated: If it is nonexistent before and after,

original: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
translated: why is that not impermanent?

original: gal te snga na med pa dang // zhig nas med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyis bcad pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snga na med pa dang // zhig nas med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyis bcad pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If existence is interrupted by the two extremes of prior nonexistence and subsequent annihilation, then it is impermanent.

original: dngos po med pa de nyid mi rtag par yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de nyid mi rtag par yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that very nonexistence to be impermanent?

original: drug pa sogs sbyor mi rung phyir //
analyzed: drug pa sogs sbyor mi rung phyir //
translated: Because it is not suitable to apply the sixth case, etc.

original: zhe na mtha' la de ji ltar //
analyzed: zhe na mtha' la de ji ltar //
translated: How is that in the case of the limit?

original: gal te bsam pa 'di yin te //
analyzed: gal te bsam pa 'di yin te //
translated: If this is your thought,

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: If impermanence is a non-thing,

original: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not related to a thing,

original: dngos po'i mi rtag pa nyid ces drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mi rtag pa nyid ces drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the application of the sixth case, etc., such as ‚Äúimpermanence of a thing,‚Äù would not exist.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la ni sbyor ba dang / 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la ni sbyor ba dang / 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not tenable that a thing and a non-thing are related by the characteristics of connection and conjunction.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩkhyad par khyad par can nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / khyad par khyad par can nyid kyis //
translated: Here we say:üîΩBy what connection is the difference of the qualifier and the qualified

original: 'brel pa gang gis zlog byed pa //
analyzed: 'brel pa gang gis zlog byed pa //
translated: reversed?

original: gal te de yang med na ni //
analyzed: gal te de yang med na ni //
translated: If that also does not exist,

original: 'o na mtha' la de ci ltar //
analyzed: 'o na mtha' la de ci ltar //
translated: how is that in the case of the limit?

original: gal te 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yang mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yang mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert the relation of qualifier and qualified because connection, etc., do not exist,

original: 'o na ni mtha' gnyis kyi yod pa nyid dam dngos po dang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo'i drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de ji ltar 'thad pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni mtha' gnyis kyi yod pa nyid dam dngos po dang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo'i drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba de ji ltar 'thad pa yin /
translated: But how can the application of the suffix -tva to the words ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúentity,‚Äù and to the words ‚Äúdistinguished‚Äù and ‚Äúdistinguishing,‚Äù be tenable?

original: yod pa nyid ni mtha'i mtshams can dang de'i khyad par can yin no zhes tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni mtha'i mtshams can dang de'i khyad par can yin no zhes tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù and ‚Äúentity‚Äù are said to be different, and ‚Äúdistinguished‚Äù is said to be distinguished by ‚Äúdistinguishing.‚Äù

original: yod nyid dang 'brel rtag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod nyid dang 'brel rtag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is related to existence,

original: mtha' yis khyad par gyur pa min //üîΩmtha' gnyis kyis bcad pa'i yod pa'am /
analyzed: mtha' yis khyad par gyur pa min // mtha' gnyis kyis bcad pa'i yod pa'am /
translated: it is not distinguished by the limit.üîΩIf you say that impermanence is the existence that is limited by the two limits,

original: de'i 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes smra ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes smra ba ni /
translated: or that it is related by the identity relation,üîΩthen you must accept that it is related to existence,

original: gdon mi za bar yod pa dang 'brel pa dag / mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par du gyur par khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yod pa dang 'brel pa dag / mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par du gyur par khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: and that it is distinguished by the two limits.

original: de ltar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not tenable,

original: gnyi ga rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that both are permanent.

original: ji ltar yod pa mtha'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa mtha'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could existence be related to the distinction of the limit?

original: gal te skye 'jig dang ldan na'o zhe na /üîΩci ste dngos po gang la yod pa nyid dam 'brel pa de dag yod pa de mtha' dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye 'jig dang ldan na'o zhe na / ci ste dngos po gang la yod pa nyid dam 'brel pa de dag yod pa de mtha' dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is if it possesses arising and disintegration,‚ÄùüîΩthen if existence or connection exists for any thing, it would be a universal.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de'i khyad par can gyi dngos po de nyid mi rtag pa yin pas yod pas ci bya /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de'i khyad par can gyi dngos po de nyid mi rtag pa yin pas yod pas ci bya /
translated: But if that is so, then that very thing which is its universal is impermanent. So what is the point of existence?

original: tha dad pa med pas drug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas drug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not different, the sixth case is not tenable.

original: yod pa nyid kyi gnas tshul zhes bya ba ci ltar yin /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi gnas tshul zhes bya ba ci ltar yin /
translated: What is the state of existence?

original: gzhan yang dngos po'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa gang yin pa de dag nyid mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa gang yin pa de dag nyid mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the so-called impermanence of things is the nonexistence of things prior to their existence and their nonexistence after their disintegration.

original: des na tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they are different, they would be different in type.

original: ci ste mtha' gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yin te /
analyzed: ci ste mtha' gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yin te /
translated: Moreover, the two extremes are cause and effect.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig yin la /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig yin la /
translated: The so-called cause is one extreme.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis pa @224a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis pa @224a * //
translated: The second extreme is called the effect.

original: yin no // rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gi yod pa nyid dam 'brel pa khyad par du byas pa la ni mi rigs pa med do //
analyzed: yin no // rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gi yod pa nyid dam 'brel pa khyad par du byas pa la ni mi rigs pa med do //
translated: There is no inconsistency in the existence of these causes and effects, or in their special relationship.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dngos po'i 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dngos po'i 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The relationship of cause and effect is characterized by the relation of cause and effect.

original: yod pa nyid dang dngos po'i 'brel pa ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang dngos po'i 'brel pa ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The relationship of existence and entity is characterized by the relation of inherence.

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gal te rgyu 'bras mtha' yin na //
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'bras mtha' yin na //
translated: If cause and effect were the extremes,

original: khyad par med pa nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid 'gyur te //
translated: there would be no difference,

original: 'brel med phyir ro de yis ni //
analyzed: 'brel med phyir ro de yis ni //
translated: because they would be unrelated.

original: dngos po sngar med 'dod min pas //
analyzed: dngos po sngar med 'dod min pas //
translated: Since it is not accepted that an entity is previously nonexistent,

original: de la de yi khyad par can //
analyzed: de la de yi khyad par can //
translated: it would not be different from that.

original: brjod pa de yang mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: brjod pa de yang mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: That statement would also be incorrect.

original: gang zhig snga na med pa de ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig snga na med pa de ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: That which is previously nonexistent becomes related to its cause.

original: dngos po ni snga na med pa dang 'brel par khas ma blangs so ;
analyzed: dngos po ni snga na med pa dang 'brel par khas ma blangs so ;
translated: But an entity is not accepted as related to what is previously nonexistent.

original: / de khas len yang snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin pas rang gi gzhung nyams pa dang / phyogs gzhan la brten par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de khas len yang snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin pas rang gi gzhung nyams pa dang / phyogs gzhan la brten par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he accepts that, then since non-existence prior to and post-destruction is impermanence, his own doctrine is undermined, and he would rely on another position.

original: des na dngos po ni snga na med pa dang 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po ni snga na med pa dang 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, an entity is only related to non-existence prior to and post-destruction.

original: brjod pa'i khyad par de ni snga na med pa'i khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i khyad par de ni snga na med pa'i khyad par can yin no //
translated: That particular expression is qualified by non-existence prior to.

original: de med na 'di ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de med na 'di ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that does not exist, then it would not be the case that ‚Äúthis is the effect.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And a cause without an effect would not exist.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, in another way, cause and effect would not exist.

original: 'di ltar / yod pa nyid dang rang rgyu dang // 'brel byed phyir na rgyu zhes grag / yod nyid de dang 'brel de yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yod pa nyid dang rang rgyu dang // 'brel byed phyir na rgyu zhes grag / yod nyid de dang 'brel de yang //
translated: Thus: Because of the existence itself and the relation with its cause, it is known as a cause. That existence itself and that relation

original: rtag na 'o na 'dir 'bras gang //
analyzed: rtag na 'o na 'dir 'bras gang //
translated: If permanent, then what effect is there here?

original: yod pa nyid dang 'brel par byed pa dang / rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang 'brel par byed pa dang / rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is that which causes the existence of an effect and that which causes the effect to be related to its cause.

original: rang gi rgyu ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu ste /
translated: The cause is the cause of the assemblage, because the effect is related to its cause.

original: skye ba can gyi dngos po dag ni phal cher 'du ba can gyi rgyu dang 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba can gyi dngos po dag ni phal cher 'du ba can gyi rgyu dang 'du ba yin no //
translated: Things that are produced are for the most part related to the cause of the assemblage.

original: yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa na 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa na 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: When it is related to existence, it is not an effect.

original: dngos po yang yod pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'bras bu yin gyi gzhan du ni 'bras bu ma yin no ;
analyzed: dngos po yang yod pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'bras bu yin gyi gzhan du ni 'bras bu ma yin no ;
translated: An entity is an effect by virtue of being related to existence, but not in any other way.

original: / rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is an effect by its very nature,

original: gang zhig med pa de byed na //
analyzed: gang zhig med pa de byed na //
translated: then what does not exist would be a cause.

original: dngos po sngar med ldan min te //
analyzed: dngos po sngar med ldan min te //
translated: An entity does not possess nonexistence.

original: 'brel pa khas len med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa khas len med phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is not accepted.

original: de phyir ril 'di rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir ril 'di rtag par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, everything would be permanent.

original: snga na med pa dang 'brel pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang 'brel pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no entity whatsoever that is related to nonexistence prior to its existence.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i phyir 'brel pa ma yin pa de lta yang 'dir sngar med pa kho na yin te des na 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i phyir 'brel pa ma yin pa de lta yang 'dir sngar med pa kho na yin te des na 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not related because it does not exist as a thing, still, it is only non-existent prior to it, and therefore it becomes the effect.

original: gang zhig med pa dang 'brel pa de med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang zhig med pa dang 'brel pa de med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is related to what is non-existent, then it is not non-existent.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then everything would be non-existent.

original: des na snga na med pa dang 'brel pa yod pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin na khas kyang ma blangs te /
analyzed: des na snga na med pa dang 'brel pa yod pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin na khas kyang ma blangs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is related to what is non-existent prior to it.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba ril rtag par thal @224b lo ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba ril rtag par thal @224b lo ;
translated: But we do not accept that, so it follows that the whole world would be permanent.

original: /'on te ci ltar dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: /'on te ci ltar dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be related to what is non-existent?

original: de phyir med don sgro 'dogs pa //
analyzed: de phyir med don sgro 'dogs pa //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of non-existence is reification.

original: brjod bya tha dad can blo ni //
analyzed: brjod bya tha dad can blo ni //
translated: The cognition that has a different object

original: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
analyzed: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
translated: Desires the non-different meaning.

original: sgra la'ang ldog pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: sgra la'ang ldog pa'i rten yin no //
translated: It is also the basis of the exclusion in the word.

original: don tha dad dam tha mi dad kyang bla ste /
analyzed: don tha dad dam tha mi dad kyang bla ste /
translated: Whether the meaning is different or not, it is all right.

original: 'brel pa ni thams cad du de la blos btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni thams cad du de la blos btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The relation is only the mind‚Äôs designation of that in all cases.üîΩIf the thing is different from the thing, what is the relation? Difference itself is the relation.üîΩIf it is allowed that they are different, what is the relation?

original: gal te dngos po la dngos po tha dad pa yin na ci zhig 'brel pa tha dad pa nyid 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la dngos po tha dad pa yin na ci zhig 'brel pa tha dad pa nyid 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, what is the relation?

original: gal te tha dad du chug mod de la 'brel pa ci zhig yod /üîΩtha dad pa ni thams cad la thun mong yin pa'i phyir ma 'brel pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i bdag dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhe na /üîΩtha dad yin na ci zhig 'brel //
analyzed: gal te tha dad du chug mod de la 'brel pa ci zhig yod / tha dad pa ni thams cad la thun mong yin pa'i phyir ma 'brel pa med par 'gyur ro // de'i bdag dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhe na / tha dad yin na ci zhig 'brel //
translated: If they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?

original: tha dad med na rgyu 'bras gang //üîΩgzhan zhig yod pas ma 'dres gnyis //
analyzed: tha dad med na rgyu 'bras gang // gzhan zhig yod pas ma 'dres gnyis //
translated: If they are not different, what is the relation?

original: ci ltar 'dre bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dre bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: If they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?

original: tha mi dad pa la ni 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde ni gnyis la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med mod /üîΩde'i bdag nyid du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la ni 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te / de ni gnyis la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med mod / de'i bdag nyid du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: If they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are different, what is the relation?üîΩIf they are not different, what is the relation?

original: de la ni 'brel ba'i yul nyid btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni 'brel ba'i yul nyid btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of the relation is a designation.

original: de la ni 'brel pa can btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ni 'brel pa can btags pa yin te /
translated: because the related object is a designation.

original: tha dad pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If they are different,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: then the relation of the nature of identity does not exist. This is established.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are cause and effect,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la 'di ci yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la 'di ci yin /
translated: what is this that is called cause and effect?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the fact of following and ceasing,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that is a designation,

original: mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa tsam yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa tsam yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of this is mere imagination, not ultimate.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas na ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar btags pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di 'jug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas na ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar btags pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'di 'jug pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, since another mode is not possible, just as the relation of a designation is based on some mode, in the same way, the application of this differentiation of difference

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa dang dngos po yang kun rdzob tu 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa dang dngos po yang kun rdzob tu 'brel pa yin te /
translated: And the relation of the non-existent, etc., to entity is also conventional,

original: don dam par ni 'ga' yang gang dang yang 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'ga' yang gang dang yang 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa yin no //
translated: but ultimately nothing is related to anything. This is certain.

original: des na kha dog gi spyi la sbyor ba'i gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na kha dog gi spyi la sbyor ba'i gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no other object of comprehension to which the universal of color is applied, there is no other valid cognition.

original: yang nas yang du ngo shes par byed pa la ni nus pa gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin te dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang nas yang du ngo shes par byed pa la ni nus pa gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin te dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: And there is no basis for the capacity to recognize again and again, as in the case of memory, etc.

original: yang ngo shes pa byed pa ni dran pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang ngo shes pa byed pa ni dran pa nyid yin no //
translated: Recognition is just memory.

original: dbang po'i byed pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa la brten pa'i phyir dang / mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it valid cognition because it is based on the function of the sense faculty and is non-deceptive?

original: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /üîΩdbang po'i bya ba ni nye ba tsam gyi yul @225a * //
analyzed: ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te / dbang po'i bya ba ni nye ba tsam gyi yul @225a * //
translated: How can recognition not be valid cognition? It is not.

original: can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function of the sense faculty is limited to the object that is merely present.

original: gal te nye ba tsam gyi yul can yin na ci ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bas 'jug can /
analyzed: gal te nye ba tsam gyi yul can yin na ci ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bas 'jug can /
translated: If it is an object that is merely near, how can it be ascertained that this is that?üîΩIt is not like that.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: For,üîΩOne does not engage in anything

original: 'di ltar / de 'di'o zhes bya tsam gyis ni //üîΩgang du'ang rtogs ldan 'jug pa min //üîΩde ni phan 'bras thob pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de 'di'o zhes bya tsam gyis ni // gang du'ang rtogs ldan 'jug pa min // de ni phan 'bras thob pa yi //
translated: merely by saying, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚ÄùüîΩOne engages in it by thinking,

original: rgyu yin snyam pa nyid kyis 'jug /
analyzed: rgyu yin snyam pa nyid kyis 'jug /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the cause of obtaining the result.‚Äù

original: gal te de nyid 'di yin pa de lta na yang 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'di yin pa de lta na yang 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is that, it does not become an object of engagement,

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i yul ni don bya bsgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i yul ni don bya bsgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of engagement of those who have understanding is the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: de nyid kyis de don bya ba sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de don bya ba sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is the cause of accomplishing the purpose.

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po rnams ni don bya ba de'ang gzhan byed pa yin gyi gcig nyid la brten pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po rnams ni don bya ba de'ang gzhan byed pa yin gyi gcig nyid la brten pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Things that depend on their own causes and have the capacity to accomplish the purpose accomplish that purpose in another way, not by depending on one thing.

original: don byed pa'i 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ni ma yin te /
translated: The connection to accomplishing the purpose is not the object of direct perception.

original: sngon mthong ba nyid dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba nyid dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the memory of what was seen before.

original: de'i don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis kyang de nyid 'dir yin no zhes shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis kyang de nyid 'dir yin no zhes shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: And it is the object of the cognition that it is this very thing, because it performs the function of that thing.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the object by way of its own nature.

original: sngon mthong ba nyid du 'dzin pa ni dran pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba nyid du 'dzin pa ni dran pa yin la /
translated: Memory is the apprehension of what was seen before.

original: 'di la sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: And inference is the application of that.

original: de'i don byed par rung ba ni 'di la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don byed par rung ba ni 'di la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: And it is possible for it to perform the function of that,

original: des na tha dad par nye bar btags pas gcig nyid kyi tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: des na tha dad par nye bar btags pas gcig nyid kyi tha snyad byed do //
translated: and therefore it is designated as different, and the convention of oneness is made.

original: mi slu ba yang gcig gi yul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang gcig gi yul can ni ma yin te /
translated: And nondeception is not the object of one,

original: du ma nyid yin yang don bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin yang don bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though there are many, the function of the object is obtained.

original: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa bgrod pa la sogs pa ni de las rab tu skyes pa'i phyir rgyun la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa bgrod pa la sogs pa ni de las rab tu skyes pa'i phyir rgyun la ltos pa yin no //
translated: And the nonpervasion of the path and so on is produced from that, so it depends on the continuum.

original: des na mngon sum ni spyi'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni spyi'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: Therefore perception is not the object of a universal.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
translated: And inference does not have a particular as its object.

original: gal te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa khyad par kho na ngo shes par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa khyad par kho na ngo shes par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that inference, which has a particular as its object, recognizes a particular?

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: skad cig sor tha dad phyir //
analyzed: skad cig sor tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference of moment,

original: khyad par ngo shes ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ngo shes ma yin no //
translated: it does not recognize a particular.

original: mthong dang mtshungs par de 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: mthong dang mtshungs par de 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because it apprehends it as similar to what was seen,

original: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min //
analyzed: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min //
translated: it does not have a particular as its object.

original: gang gi tshe me mthong nas song ste chod pa'i tshe yang du ba las nges par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me mthong nas song ste chod pa'i tshe yang du ba las nges par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one goes after seeing fire and then infers fire from smoke when it is obscured,

original: khyad par de nyid dus gzhan du ngo shes par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid dus gzhan du ngo shes par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: at that time it does not recognize that very particular at another time,

original: tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is different from the previous one.

original: tha dad par gyur pa la gcig tu lhag par zhen pas rtogs pa ni spyi yul du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa la gcig tu lhag par zhen pas rtogs pa ni spyi yul du byed pa yin no //
translated: When one conceives of what is different as the same, the universal is taken as the object.

original: 'o na gang la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir tha dad pa mi srid pa /
analyzed: 'o na gang la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir tha dad pa mi srid pa /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúHow can it be different when there is no change?‚Äù

original: don gyi bdag nyid brten pa yin pa de la ni khyad par de nyid ngo shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid brten pa yin pa de la ni khyad par de nyid ngo shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the very same thing that is the basis of the cognition of the universal and the cognition of the particular, then the cognition of the particular would recognize that very thing.

original: 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: mi snang ba ni 'gyur ba med pa yin no zhes nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba ni 'gyur ba med pa yin no zhes nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that what is not seen is unchanging.

original: ci ste gzhan du yang de @225b lta bu nyid du mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du yang de @225b lta bu nyid du mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But if it is seen in another way,

original: de lta na ni mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan dang chos mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni mthong ba'i gsal ba gzhan dang chos mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
translated: then it is not a cognition of a universal, because it is a cognition of a particular that is similar to what is seen.

original: gal te de nyid dpe yin pa //
analyzed: gal te de nyid dpe yin pa //
translated: If you say that it is an example of that,

original: phyir na spyi 'dzin min zhe na //
analyzed: phyir na spyi 'dzin min zhe na //
translated: then it is not a cognition of a universal.

original: dpe nyid yin phyir grub de la //
analyzed: dpe nyid yin phyir grub de la //
translated: If it is an example, then it is established,

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: so what is the use of another valid cognition?

original: gal te sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir de nyid dang dpe yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir de nyid dang dpe yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is an example of that because it is already established by perception,

original: de lta yin na ni sngar gyi mngon sum nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir 'di rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan ci dgos /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni sngar gyi mngon sum nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir 'di rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gzhan ci dgos /
translated: then, since it is already apprehended by perception, what is the use of another valid cognition, namely inference?

original: gal te khyad par lta bar byed pa'i mngon sum snga ma de nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'gyur ba'i yod pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyad par lta bar byed pa'i mngon sum snga ma de nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'gyur ba'i yod pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: If the prior perception that perceives the difference itself apprehends the existence of the object at the time of inference,

original: de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the use of inference to prove that very object?

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa la 'jug par 'dod kyi de nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa la 'jug par 'dod kyi de nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference is asserted to engage objects that are not the domain of perception, but not to engage that very object.

original: gal te de nyid kyi phyir khyad par mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi phyir khyad par mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because of that very fact that the difference is seen,

original: khyad par mthong ba yin na ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba yin na ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then if the difference is seen, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: ci ste mthong bas ni dus mnyam du byung ba'i don 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste mthong bas ni dus mnyam du byung ba'i don 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that perception apprehends objects that occur simultaneously with it, but not others,

original: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is a valid cognition of inference that engages future objects.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ni gang gis rang bzhin sngar shes pa dpe yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ni gang gis rang bzhin sngar shes pa dpe yang gzhan yin la /
