analyzed: yang na rtogs par byed pa'i shes pa nyid kyi mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the sameness is due to the cognition that apprehends them,

original: don ni 'ga' zhig gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni 'ga' zhig gi yang ma yin no //
translated: but not due to any object.

original: 'on te sgra las skye ba na de nyid mi gsal ba'i rnam par gyur pa ni spyi yin te /üîΩthams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te ba lang zhes brjod pa na res 'ga' ni /üîΩkhra bo dang res 'ga' ni ser skya zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir de yang so sor nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas spyi'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sgra las skye ba na de nyid mi gsal ba'i rnam par gyur pa ni spyi yin te / thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te ba lang zhes brjod pa na res 'ga' ni / khra bo dang res 'ga' ni ser skya zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir de yang so sor nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas spyi'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that a universal is a sound that is not clear,üîΩbecause it is the same for all, then that is not so, because when the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is uttered, sometimes it is understood as ‚Äúa cow is white,‚Äù and sometimes it is understood as ‚Äúa cow is brown,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyams su myong ba ji ltar ba bzhin dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ji ltar ba bzhin dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is a conceptual cognition that is individually determined, it is not a universal, because it is a memory that is in accordance with an experience.

original: sgra 'di ni sngar thams cad dang 'brel par mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'di ni sngar thams cad dang 'brel par mthong ba yin te /
translated: This sound is seen to be related to everything,

original: go sgra don dgu la 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: go sgra don dgu la 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: like the word ‚Äúgo‚Äù which has nine meanings.

original: gal te ba lang la sogs pa don dug po dag ni so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nye bar ston par byed pa dang ston pa'i yul can gyi brda srid pa yin gyi //
analyzed: gal te ba lang la sogs pa don dug po dag ni so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nye bar ston par byed pa dang ston pa'i yul can gyi brda srid pa yin gyi //
translated: If the objects, such as the cow, etc., are individually determined, then it is possible to make and understand a conventional symbol that points to them.

original: so sor nges pa med pa'i gsal ba rnams la ji ltar brda byed pa'am 'dzin par nus she na /
analyzed: so sor nges pa med pa'i gsal ba rnams la ji ltar brda byed pa'am 'dzin par nus she na /
translated: But how can one make or understand a conventional symbol for the manifestations that are not individually determined?

original: 'di ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if that were so,

original: @236a * // mig gi yul gyi don la ni mthong ba med do //
analyzed: @236a * // mig gi yul gyi don la ni mthong ba med do //
translated: there is no seeing of the object of the eye.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni mig gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni mig gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the eye consciousness that manifests the manifestation, there is no manifestation of the eye.

original: de nyid 'di'o snyam pa'i rtog pa 'byung ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o snyam pa'i rtog pa 'byung ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: It is only the thought that arises, ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not logical that the manifestation and the non-manifestation appear as one.

original: / rgyu tha dad pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: / rgyu tha dad pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: And because of the difference in causes.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / bag chags rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / bag chags rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye, etc., and the latent impressions are the causes.

original: de'i phyir na mig la sogs pas bskyed pa'i blo la ni snang ba gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na mig la sogs pas bskyed pa'i blo la ni snang ba gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition produced by the eye and so on does not have two appearances.

original: ci ste gal te rnam pa'i rgyu tha dad pa yin du chug kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i phyir blo de ni gcig nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gal te rnam pa'i rgyu tha dad pa yin du chug kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i phyir blo de ni gcig nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if the cause of the aspect is different, then how can the cognition be one, since it appears both clearly and unclearly?

original: de la mi brjod de /
analyzed: de la mi brjod de /
translated: We do not say that.

original: gal te snang ba'i rgyu tha dad kyang blo rnams tha mi dad pa yin na gzhan du yang tha dad pa rnyed par dka' bar 'gyur te thams cad du dus mnyam par 'byung ba'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi blo gcig kho nar 'gyur ro
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i rgyu tha dad kyang blo rnams tha mi dad pa yin na gzhan du yang tha dad pa rnyed par dka' bar 'gyur te thams cad du dus mnyam par 'byung ba'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi blo gcig kho nar 'gyur ro
translated: If the cognitions are not different even though the causes of the appearance are different, then it is difficult to find a difference in other cases as well, because in all cases, the cognitions of direct perception and inference that occur simultaneously would be one cognition.

original: // gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pa ji ltar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: // gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pa ji ltar mi 'dzin te /
translated: But why do you not apprehend the relation of contact?

original: rigs la sogs pa tha dad par nges pa med pa ni 'phrod pa'i 'du ba yod pa nyid las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa tha dad par nges pa med pa ni 'phrod pa'i 'du ba yod pa nyid las yin no zhe na /
translated: The absence of ascertainment of the difference of type and so on is due to the mere existence of contact.

original: 'di ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: 'di ltar / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
translated: Because there is no apprehension of contact by the sense faculties.

original: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas //
translated: But without seeing a connection, they do not exist.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pas rig par srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pas rig par srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Since the contact of the cloth with the threads is beyond the senses, it is not possible to know it with the eye or any other sense faculty.

original: ci ste snal ma 'di dag la snam bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las 'phrod pa 'du ba 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste snal ma 'di dag la snam bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las 'phrod pa 'du ba 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the contact of the cloth with the threads is established from the convention ‚ÄúThis cloth is in the threads,‚Äù then that is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is because:

original: 'di ltar / snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes //
translated: The words ‚ÄúThis cloth is in the threads‚Äù

original: sgra 'di dag kyang rang gis byas //üîΩsnal ma rnams la snam bu /
analyzed: sgra 'di dag kyang rang gis byas // snal ma rnams la snam bu /
translated: are also produced by themselves.üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúThis cloth is in the threads‚Äù never occurs to anyone.

original: rva la sogs pa rnams la ba lang zhes bya ba'i blo ni 'gar yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rva la sogs pa rnams la ba lang zhes bya ba'i blo ni 'gar yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúA cow is in the horns‚Äù and so on never occurs to anyone.

original: de med pas 'phrod pa'i 'du ba ji ltar rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: de med pas 'phrod pa'i 'du ba ji ltar rtogs pa yin /
translated: Since that thought does not occur, how could the contact of the cloth with the threads be understood?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩba lang rva zhes 'jig rten na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / ba lang rva zhes 'jig rten na //
translated: Because:üîΩIn the world, the phrase ‚Äúcow‚Äôs horns‚Äù

original: rva la ba lang 'jig rten min //
analyzed: rva la ba lang 'jig rten min //
translated: is not the same as ‚Äúhorns of a cow.‚Äù

original: ba lang rva yod do zhes bya ba'i blo ni 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: ba lang rva yod do zhes bya ba'i blo ni 'jug pa yin na /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúA cow is in the horns‚Äù does not occur to anyone.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ni de la 'phrod pas 'dus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa de dag ni de la 'phrod pas 'dus pa ma yin no //
translated: The dewlap, etc., are not combined with the cow, since they are not in contact with it.

original: gang zhig de dag la 'du bar 'dod pa de ni brten pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de dag la 'du bar 'dod pa de ni brten pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: One who believes that they are combined with it does not understand the meaning of ‚Äúcombination.‚Äù

original: des na blo 'di ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na blo 'di ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the cognition of the cow is not due to a combination of the perceptible things,üîΩbut rather,

original: 'on kyang / ba lang zhes bya yan lag ni //üîΩlhag ma rnams chad dmigs med phyir //
analyzed: 'on kyang / ba lang zhes bya yan lag ni // lhag ma rnams chad dmigs med phyir //
translated: the cognition of the cow is due to the remaining parts,üîΩbecause the cognition of the cow is not perceived when the parts are missing.

original: 'di las snyam pa'i blo ni 'du ba med pa la dmigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di las snyam pa'i blo ni 'du ba med pa la dmigs pa nyid de /
translated: The cognition of the cow is not due to a combination of the parts, but rather, it is due to the remaining parts, because the cognition of the cow is not perceived when the parts are missing.

original: dper na nyi ma nub ka'i dus na shing 'di la nyi ma'o @236b zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma nub ka'i dus na shing 'di la nyi ma'o @236b zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: For example, at the time of sunset, one says, ‚ÄúThe sun is in that tree.‚Äù

original: yan lag lhag ma dag la ba lang ngo zhes rtogs na rva'i rten nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ba lang la rva'o snyam du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma dag la ba lang ngo zhes rtogs na rva'i rten nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ba lang la rva'o snyam du shes pa yin no //
translated: If one understands the cow in the remaining parts, one knows that the cow has horns, because the horns are designated as the support of the cow.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig rten dang brten par 'gyur ba la rva la sogs pa'i tshogs las tha dad pa'i ba lang ni med de 'di ni rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig rten dang brten par 'gyur ba la rva la sogs pa'i tshogs las tha dad pa'i ba lang ni med de 'di ni rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Thus, the cow is not separate from the collection of horns, etc., which are the supported, and the remaining parts, which are the support. This is mere imagination.

original: ci ste yang snal ma 'di dag la snam bu'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni 'byung ba kho na zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang snal ma 'di dag la snam bu'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni 'byung ba kho na zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the cognition of cloth arises from these threads alone,

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩsnal ma 'di rnams kyis snam bu //üîΩ'di zhes snal ma 'dus byas las //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / snal ma 'di rnams kyis snam bu // 'di zhes snal ma 'dus byas las //
translated: that is not so.üîΩThe threads are the cause of the cloth.üîΩThe cloth is said to arise later

original: phyis byung 'bras bur brjod yin gyi //
analyzed: phyis byung 'bras bur brjod yin gyi //
translated: from the assemblage of the threads.

original: ji lta bur yang dus gcig min //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang dus gcig min //
translated: But it does not exist at the same time as the threads.

original: snal ma'i sgra ni sngar snam bu med pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'jug par 'gyur la de'i phyis 'byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni snam bu yin no //
analyzed: snal ma'i sgra ni sngar snam bu med pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'jug par 'gyur la de'i phyis 'byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni snam bu yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúthread‚Äù is used in the context of the prior nonexistence of cloth. Later, the cloth is said to arise from the assemblage of the threads.

original: de'i snal ma de dag gi snam bu 'di byas so zhes de'i phyis 'byung ba la 'bras bur bsnyad pa yin gyi snal ma dang dus mtshungs pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i snal ma de dag gi snam bu 'di byas so zhes de'i phyis 'byung ba la 'bras bur bsnyad pa yin gyi snal ma dang dus mtshungs pa ni ma yin no /
translated: The cloth is said to be the effect that arises later from the assemblage of the threads. It is not simultaneous with the threads.

original: des na gang las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: des na gang las rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin /
translated: Therefore, how could the cloth be the supported and the threads the supporters?

original: dus tha dad pa dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: dus tha dad pa dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin gyi ;
translated: Things that exist at different times cannot be the supported and the supporters.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dam 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dam 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It would follow that there would be no relation between cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i khyad par nyid /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i khyad par nyid /
translated: Therefore, the relation of support and supported is just the relation of cause and effect, since it is based on a single collection.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i khar gzhong dang de la brten par 'dod pa dag kho na la de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i khar gzhong dang de la brten par 'dod pa dag kho na la de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The relation of support and supported is only a conventional expression for that which is based on a single collection, just as a dish and the food in it are said to be supported.

original: gnas pa ni de'i rang bzhin khyad par las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de'i rang bzhin khyad par las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The supported is not different from the nature of the support.

original: snal ma dang snam bu dag la rtogs pa 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snal ma dang snam bu dag la rtogs pa 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case with cloth and threads.

original: des na rnam pa ci zhig ltar rnam par brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na rnam pa ci zhig ltar rnam par brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the relation of support and supported is not a relation of cause and effect, because they are not different.

original: snam bu'i gnas skabs na ni snal ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bu'i gnas skabs na ni snal ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The threads do not exist in the cloth.

original: gal te tha dad pa med na snam bu'i gnas skabs snal ma med pa'i phyir snal ma de dag ni 'di yin no zhes shes pa 'am snam bu 'di zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa med na snam bu'i gnas skabs snal ma med pa'i phyir snal ma de dag ni 'di yin no zhes shes pa 'am snam bu 'di zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhen /
translated: If they are not different, then since the thread does not exist at the time of the cloth, how could one know that ‚Äúthese are the threads‚Äù or that ‚Äúthis is cloth‚Äù?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is not so.

original: don dam par ni de la gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni de la gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, they are not two.üîΩFor example,

original: 'di ltar / 'ga' yis rgyu sgro btags pa 'am //üîΩsgra yi rten ni ston pa na //üîΩsnal ma gcig ni bkar byas pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'ga' yis rgyu sgro btags pa 'am // sgra yi rten ni ston pa na // snal ma gcig ni bkar byas pas //
translated: when someone points out a cause,üîΩsaying ‚ÄúThis is a thread,‚Äù

original: 'bras la snal ma zhes 'jug 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras la snal ma zhes 'jug 'gyur //
translated: the word ‚Äúthread‚Äù is applied to the effect.

original: snam bu ni snal ma dag gi 'bras bu yin pas de'i tshe snal ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bu ni snal ma dag gi 'bras bu yin pas de'i tshe snal ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since cloth is the effect of threads, at that time the threads do not exist.

original: snal mar shes pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin sgro btags pa las yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di @237a * //
analyzed: snal mar shes pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin sgro btags pa las yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no // 'di @237a * //
translated: The knowledge of threads is due to the imputation of the nature of the cause, but not in reality.

original: ltar 'di snal ma yin no snyam pa'i shes pa ni snga ma dran pa yod na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltar 'di snal ma yin no snyam pa'i shes pa ni snga ma dran pa yod na 'gyur ro //
translated: For this reason, the knowledge that thinks ‚ÄúThis is a thread‚Äù occurs when there is memory of the previous.

original: yang na gcig bkar ba las yin te /
analyzed: yang na gcig bkar ba las yin te /
translated: Or it is due to the selection of one.

original: snal ma re rer bkar na snam bu zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snal ma re rer bkar na snam bu zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you separate out each thread, there is no so-called cloth.

original: dmag dang nags la sogs pa ltar de dag ni tshogs pa nyid snam bu'i tha snyad rten yin no //
analyzed: dmag dang nags la sogs pa ltar de dag ni tshogs pa nyid snam bu'i tha snyad rten yin no //
translated: Like an army, a forest, and so on, the mere collection of those threads is the basis for the convention of cloth.

original: snam bu ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do /
analyzed: snam bu ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do /
translated: Cloth exists conventionally.

original: des na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the relationship of support and supported is imputed.

original: gal te snam bu zhes bya ba med pa yin na ji ltar snam bu'i sgra 'jug pa ste rgyu mtshan med par sgra 'jug pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snam bu zhes bya ba med pa yin na ji ltar snam bu'i sgra 'jug pa ste rgyu mtshan med par sgra 'jug pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: If there is no so-called cloth, how can the term cloth be used? A term cannot be used without a reason.

original: 'di la lan du /
analyzed: 'di la lan du /
translated: In response to this, the text says:

original: phan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam //
analyzed: phan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam //
translated: The reason for the convention of cloth isüîΩthe appearance of the threads

original: rnam par chad med snang ba nyid //üîΩsnam bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par chad med snang ba nyid // snam bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: as the supported and the warp and weft as the support.üîΩThe reason for the convention of cloth is the appearance of the threads as the supported and the warp and weft as the support.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.

original: de la phan gdags bya dang 'dogs byed nyid de /
analyzed: de la phan gdags bya dang 'dogs byed nyid de /
translated: The appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of the threads as the object designated as cloth.

original: snal ma de dag nyid phan tshun phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: snal ma de dag nyid phan tshun phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'am /
translated: The appearance of the warp and weft as the support is the appearance of the warp and weft as the basis for the designation of cloth.üîΩThe appearance of the threads as the supported is the appearance of

original: ldan pa'i khyad par las /
analyzed: ldan pa'i khyad par las /
translated: The difference in the possession of the cloth, etc.

original: bgo ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i don bya ba nye bar bskyed pa ni snam bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgo ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i don bya ba nye bar bskyed pa ni snam bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the basis for the conventional expressions ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù etc., because it generates the desired effect of covering, etc.

original: de dag gi phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i dngos po de ni snam bu zhes bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i dngos po de ni snam bu zhes bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: The fact that they are helpful is to be understood as the cloth, etc.

original: ji ltar thag bzangs dang snas la sogs pas phan btags pa dang 'bral ba rnam par chad pa'i snal ma dag brtsal ba med par phan tshun gyis pa de bzhin du snam bu'i gnas skabs na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar thag bzangs dang snas la sogs pas phan btags pa dang 'bral ba rnam par chad pa'i snal ma dag brtsal ba med par phan tshun gyis pa de bzhin du snam bu'i gnas skabs na ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the separated threads, which are devoid of the help of the shuttle, etc., are not the cloth, because they are not sought after as the cloth, so also they are not in the state of the cloth.

original: de'i phyir rnam par chad pa ma mthong ba ni 'di'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir tha snyad nyid las don gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par chad pa ma mthong ba ni 'di'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir tha snyad nyid las don gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-perception of the separation is the reason for it, it is not to be imagined as something other than the conventional expression itself.

original: don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: The reason for the understanding of the object is the valid cognition.

original: tha snyad ni phal cher gzhan du yang 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad ni phal cher gzhan du yang 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The conventional expression is also used in other cases.

original: gal te tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med na de ltar gyur na ni 'o na snam bu'i tha snyad dngos ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med na de ltar gyur na ni 'o na snam bu'i tha snyad dngos ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If, in the absence of any other reason for the conventional expression, it is so, then the expression ‚Äúcloth‚Äù would not be a real entity.

original: khur bu ba la ba lang du bsnyad ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khur bu ba la ba lang du bsnyad ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the expression ‚Äúox‚Äù applied to a donkey.

original: khur bu ba la gtsang sbra chung ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yod kyang de las tha snyad pa'i ba lang nyid kyi spyi med pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi tha snyad kyi dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: khur bu ba la gtsang sbra chung ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yod kyang de las tha snyad pa'i ba lang nyid kyi spyi med pa'i phyir ba lang nyid kyi tha snyad kyi dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Although there is a reason for the expression ‚Äúox‚Äù applied to a donkey, such as its small tail, etc., it is not a real entity for the expression ‚Äúox‚Äù because there is no universal ‚Äúox‚Äù in the donkey.

original: phan gdags bya 'dogs byed la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi snam bu'i tha snyad 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phan gdags bya 'dogs byed la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi snam bu'i tha snyad 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the expression ‚Äúcloth‚Äù would be a reason for the expression ‚Äúthat which is to be benefited and that which benefits,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di la lan glon pa ni /üîΩ'khrul med can shes dang po yi //
analyzed: 'di la lan glon pa ni / 'khrul med can shes dang po yi //
translated: The response to this is as follows.üîΩThat which is the object of the first

original: brda yi spyod yul gang yin dngos //üîΩdang po'i brda'i yul gang yi pa de ni dngos po yin te /
analyzed: brda yi spyod yul gang yin dngos // dang po'i brda'i yul gang yi pa de ni dngos po yin te /
translated: conventional expression of one who is not confused is a real entity.

original: dang po'i brda'i yul yin pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po'i brda'i yul yin pa nyid kyis 'khrul pa med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the object of the first conventional expression is a real entity because it is known without confusion by the first conventional expression.

original: gang zhig brda'i yul gyi dngos po dang chos @237b mtshungs pa na de nyid du lhag par zhen nas zhugs pa de ni de'i dngos po ma yin te 'khrul pa'i blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig brda'i yul gyi dngos po dang chos @237b mtshungs pa na de nyid du lhag par zhen nas zhugs pa de ni de'i dngos po ma yin te 'khrul pa'i blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When something is similar to a referential object, one who is attached to it as being just that is engaged in what is not real because it is the object of a deluded mind.

original: snal ma'i tshul med na 'dra ba las gzhan pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs bas shes pa la 'khrul pa yin pa de /
analyzed: snal ma'i tshul med na 'dra ba las gzhan pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs bas shes pa la 'khrul pa yin pa de /
translated: If there is no way of being a cloth, then it is a delusion of consciousness that follows a phenomenon that is different from a resemblance.

original: de'i rjes su ma 'brangs par ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su ma 'brangs par ni de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If one does not follow that, then it will not be like that.

original: de'i phyir dngos dang btags pa'i dbye ba las ni snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan yin par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos dang btags pa'i dbye ba las ni snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan yin par mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, because of the distinction between real and nominal, it is not established that the reasons for the words cloth and so on are other.

original: ci ste rigs la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rigs la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If one proves by inference that it is a class and so on,üîΩthen it is like this:

original: 'di ltar / de yi ngo bor gzhan shes pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de yi ngo bor gzhan shes pa //
translated: The cognition of its nature is

original: de mtshungs rgyu mtshan las yin te //
analyzed: de mtshungs rgyu mtshan las yin te //
translated: from a reason that is similar to it.

original: dper na dbyig can snyam shes pa //
analyzed: dper na dbyig can snyam shes pa //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of a clubman

original: mtshungs pa'i dbyig pa las yin bzhin //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i dbyig pa las yin bzhin //
translated: that is from a similar club.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun skyes bu la sogs pa la yang dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i mtshungs par rtogs pa ni mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun skyes bu la sogs pa la yang dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i mtshungs par rtogs pa ni mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: Also, in the case of a person and so on, which are dissimilar, the cognition that thinks ‚Äúhe has a stick‚Äù is based on a similar reason.

original: khra bo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag la ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo de la yang ba lang nyid rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag la ba lang ngo snyam pa'i blo de la yang ba lang nyid rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: In the case of a cognition that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù with regard to a multicolored object, which is dissimilar, cowness is the reason.üîΩIt is like the case of the stick.

original: dbyig pa bzhin no zhe na 'di ni lan du mi rung ste /üîΩ'di ltar / dngos po las ni tha dad can /
analyzed: dbyig pa bzhin no zhe na 'di ni lan du mi rung ste / 'di ltar / dngos po las ni tha dad can /
translated: This is not a proper response.üîΩBecause there is no inference

original: rigs sogs la ni rjes dpag med //
analyzed: rigs sogs la ni rjes dpag med //
translated: of universals and so on that are different from things.üîΩThe convention of ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on

original: dbyig pa can sogs thams cad la //üîΩkun rdzob pa las tha snyad 'dogs //
analyzed: dbyig pa can sogs thams cad la // kun rdzob pa las tha snyad 'dogs //
translated: is applied to all that have a variegated body.

original: gal te kun rdzob pa'i mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas khra bo la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i shes 'jug pa yin na ni de'i tshe grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob pa'i mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas khra bo la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i shes 'jug pa yin na ni de'i tshe grub pa nyid do //
translated: If the engagement of the cognition that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on with regard to a multicolored object and so on is based on a similar reason that is conventional, then that is established.

original: 'di ltar dbyig pa can no zhes bya ba'i shes pa la yang dbyig pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyig pa can no zhes bya ba'i shes pa la yang dbyig pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: In the case of the cognition that thinks ‚Äúhe has a stick,‚Äù the stick is not the reason.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad dbyug pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad dbyug pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be a stick.

original: 'on te 'brel pa las 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa las 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is due to a relation,

original: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can no snyam du shes pa las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can no snyam du shes pa las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then the understanding of the relation is due to the understanding of the relata.

original: de la yang 'brel pa gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'brel pa gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the relation is understood through another relation, then there is an infinite regress.

original: ci ste 'brel pa gzhan med par 'brel pa can no zhes na de lta yin na ni 'brel pa yang brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste 'brel pa gzhan med par 'brel pa can no zhes na de lta yin na ni 'brel pa yang brtags pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that the relata are related without another relation, then the relation itself is nonexistent.

original: des na dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob pa'i rgyu mtshan kho na las yin no //
analyzed: des na dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob pa'i rgyu mtshan kho na las yin no //
translated: Therefore the cognition that thinks stick is due to the mere basis of the conventional.

original: de nyid 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: de nyid 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: Since that is the relation, everything is the same.

original: ci ste dbyig pa dang 'byor pa nyid ni bden pa kho na yin gyi kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dbyig pa dang 'byor pa nyid ni bden pa kho na yin gyi kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the stick and the relation are real but not conventional,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: then that is not true.

original: de las tha dad pa'i 'byor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i 'byor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation that is different from that.

original: gnyis po tsam nyid 'byor ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gnyis po tsam nyid 'byor ba yin na ni /
translated: If the mere two are the relation,

original: ji ltar skyes bu dbyig pa can zhes bya ba de bzhin du dbyig pa skyes bu can zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na gnyis po tsam @238a * //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu dbyig pa can zhes bya ba de bzhin du dbyig pa skyes bu can zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro // yang na gnyis po tsam @238a * //
translated: Just as one says, ‚Äúthe man with the stick,‚Äù so too one would say, ‚Äúthe stick of the man.‚Äù

original: zhig snang ba yin na /
analyzed: zhig snang ba yin na /
translated: Or, if only the two are seen,

original: 'di dag phan tshun 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the thought would be, ‚ÄúThese two are related to each other,‚Äù

original: de dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but they would not be the qualified and the qualifier.

original: ci ste dbyig pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas gtso bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dbyig pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas gtso bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the stick is not the primary factor because it is the helper,

original: de lta yin na kun rdzob pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid de la rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na kun rdzob pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid de la rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: then the very helper in the conventional sense is the reason for that.

original: de yang mngon sum la snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum la snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And that is not seen in perception,

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi rtogs pa ni dbang po las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi rtogs pa ni dbang po las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: so the cognition of that as the qualified is not derived from the senses.

original: ci ste yang khyad par gyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang khyad par gyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that the nature of the qualifier is conventional,

original: khyad par dbyig pa nyid ni don dam pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na ma yin te ;
analyzed: khyad par dbyig pa nyid ni don dam pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid la sogs pa yang yin no zhe na ma yin te ;
translated: In particular, just as a stick is ultimate reality, so too a cow and so on would be ultimate reality.

original: tha dad par mngon sum gyi gzung ba'i phyir dbyig pa ni don dam par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha dad par mngon sum gyi gzung ba'i phyir dbyig pa ni don dam par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But that is not so, because a stick is apprehended by direct perception as distinct from a cow and so on.

original: rigs la sogs pa ni don dam par 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩ'phrod pa 'du bas tha dad par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩ'phrod pa 'du ba nyid ci'i phyir tha dad par mi snang /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa ni don dam par 'gyur ba ma yin no // 'phrod pa 'du bas tha dad par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na / 'phrod pa 'du ba nyid ci'i phyir tha dad par mi snang /
translated: A stick is ultimate reality, but a cow and so on are not ultimate reality.üîΩBut a cow is not distinct from its color and so on.üîΩWhy does a cow not appear as distinct from its color and so on?üîΩBecause a cow is a composite of color and so on.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba gzhan dag las so zhe na /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba gzhan dag las so zhe na /
translated: But why does a composite not appear as distinct from other composites?

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang / der yang don dam pa yi ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / der yang don dam pa yi ni //
translated: Moreover,üîΩthere would be a connection

original: don gyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid //
analyzed: don gyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid //
translated: with the ultimate.

original: bzho dag la la sogs 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: bzho dag la la sogs 'bras bu ni //
translated: Some say that the result

original: don dam nyid kyis der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam nyid kyis der 'gyur ro //
translated: is ultimate reality.

original: ji ltar don dam pa'i dbyig pa nyid dbyig pa can ni snyam du mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam pa'i dbyig pa nyid dbyig pa can ni snyam du mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa /
translated: Just as a stick is the reason for the cognition that thinks a stick is a stick, so too a cow is the reason for the cognition that thinks a cow is a cow.

original: de kho na ltar dgal ba la sogs pa'am rva la sogs pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ltar dgal ba la sogs pa'am rva la sogs pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The horns, etc. are the reason for the cow, etc.

original: rva la sogs pa ni tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rva la sogs pa ni tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the horns, etc. are different,

original: dbyig pa la sogs pa yang tha dad par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyig pa la sogs pa yang tha dad par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: then the stick, etc. are also different, and are similar.

original: mtshungs pa yang tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dbyig pa can zhes bya ba dper 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshungs pa yang tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dbyig pa can zhes bya ba dper 'gyur /
translated: And if the similar are different, how can the example be like the man with the stick?

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid la tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin no //üîΩdag la sogs 'brel pa las gzhan pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid la tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin no // dag la sogs 'brel pa las gzhan pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is the non-different that is understood as different.üîΩThe class of the cow, etc. is not seen anywhere else

original: rigs ni 'gar yang mthong ba med //
analyzed: rigs ni 'gar yang mthong ba med //
translated: than the connection of the horns, etc.

original: de dag rnams la ba lang nyid //
analyzed: de dag rnams la ba lang nyid //
translated: In those, what is the cow

original: ci zhes pa 'di rva sogs ston //
analyzed: ci zhes pa 'di rva sogs ston //
translated: that is taught by the horns, etc.?

original: ji ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs 'dri na /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs 'dri na /
translated: When the class of the Brahmin, etc. is asked,

original: rus dang 'don pa la sogs pa ston gyi rigs ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid la yang bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa ston gyi tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa'i rigs gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rus dang 'don pa la sogs pa ston gyi rigs ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang nyid la yang bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa ston gyi tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa'i rigs gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù indicates the act of milking, the act of eating grass, and so on, but does not indicate a universal, in the same way, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù indicates the act of milking, the act of eating grass, and so on, but does not indicate any other universal that is the object of valid cognition.

original: des na dngos su tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang du yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rigs don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos su tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang du yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rigs don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the ultimate sign of the object of conventional expression does not exist anywhere, the universal does not exist ultimately.

original: rigs ni tha snyad kyi yul nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni tha snyad kyi yul nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The universal is asserted to be the object of conventional expression.

original: de ni kun rdzob pa kho nas 'grub pa'i phyir rigs ni @238b don med do //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob pa kho nas 'grub pa'i phyir rigs ni @238b don med do //
translated: Since it is established by the conventional alone, the universal is meaningless.

original: gzhan yang gal te thams cad du tha snyad don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te thams cad du tha snyad don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas 'jug pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if all conventional expressions engage in dependence on the ultimate sign,

original: de'i tshe de la ltos pa med pa'i sgra med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la ltos pa med pa'i sgra med par 'gyur na /
translated: then, since there would be no words that do not depend on that,üîΩthere would be no conventional expressions.

original: mthong ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: dngos po khang bzangs phreng sogs kyi //
analyzed: dngos po khang bzangs phreng sogs kyi //
translated: houses, garlands, and so on

original: sgra yang gzhan la ltos pa min //
analyzed: sgra yang gzhan la ltos pa min //
translated: Sound is not dependent on another.

original: tshig gi don drug po dag la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa dang / khang bzangs rnams la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don drug po dag la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa dang / khang bzangs rnams la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The six categories are designated as entities, and the designation of a mansion as a ‚Äúrow of mansions‚Äù and so on is not dependent on another reason.

original: rdzas la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la ni dngos po nyid ces bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams la ni dngos po nyid ces bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The categories of substance and so on do not have another called ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: re zhig dngos po nyid rdzas ni ma yin te rdzas ni yon tan la sogs pa rnams la 'du ba'am ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po nyid rdzas ni ma yin te rdzas ni yon tan la sogs pa rnams la 'du ba'am ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: An entity is not a substance, because a substance is not a collection or possessor of qualities and so on.

original: khang bzangs kyang rdzas nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khang bzangs kyang rdzas nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: A mansion is not a substance,

original: rigs mi mthun pas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced by a substance of a different type.

original: ldan pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ldan pa nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is a possessor,

original: de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni /
translated: then the following is explained.

original: gal te khang pa ldan pa yin du chug na 'dir phreng ba ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te khang pa ldan pa yin du chug na 'dir phreng ba ci zhig yin /
translated: If a mansion is a possessor, then what is a row here?

original: de smras pa ni /
analyzed: de smras pa ni /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: gal te khang pa ldan yin yang //
analyzed: gal te khang pa ldan yin yang //
translated: If it is a collection,

original: de phreng de ni ci zhig yin //
analyzed: de phreng de ni ci zhig yin //
translated: what is the nature of that collection?

original: rdzas ma yin la yon tan dang las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas ma yin la yon tan dang las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a substance, nor is it a quality or an action,

original: rdzas ni yon tan la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni yon tan la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a substance does not exist without a quality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yon tan yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yon tan yang ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not a quality.

original: las kyang ma yin te las ni rdzas la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyang ma yin te las ni rdzas la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it an action, because an action is based on a substance.

original: 'du ba dang khyad par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du ba dang khyad par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a conjunction or a disjunction,

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have a result.

original: gal te rigs ni yon tan la yang yod pa'i phyir rigs yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs ni yon tan la yang yod pa'i phyir rigs yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that a universal is a universal because it exists in a quality,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: rigs ni rigs la mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: rigs ni rigs la mtshungs pa yi //
translated: A universal is a universal only

original: tha snyad don du brtags pa nyid //
analyzed: tha snyad don du brtags pa nyid //
translated: in the sense that it is imagined to be so in regard to a universal.

original: der yang 'di yi tha snyad kyi //
analyzed: der yang 'di yi tha snyad kyi //
translated: In that case, the reason for the designation

original: rgyu mtshan rigs gzhan yin par 'gyur //üîΩde yang rigs gzhan dag nyid las ;
analyzed: rgyu mtshan rigs gzhan yin par 'gyur // de yang rigs gzhan dag nyid las ;
translated: of a universal would be another universal.

original: / rigs su bsnyad pa'i yul du 'gyur //
analyzed: / rigs su bsnyad pa'i yul du 'gyur //
translated: And that would be the object of the designationüîΩof a universal only in regard to another universal.

original: de phyir rtogs pa mtha' med pas //
analyzed: de phyir rtogs pa mtha' med pas //
translated: Therefore, there would be an infinite regress.

original: rtogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that there is realization.üîΩ

original: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the application of the term ‚Äúgarland,‚Äù etc., is not based on that.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te rigs yin kha cig kyang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te rigs yin kha cig kyang //
translated: If it is a type, then even one

original: shing bzhin phreng zhes brjod par 'gyur //
analyzed: shing bzhin phreng zhes brjod par 'gyur //
translated: would be called a ‚Äúgarland,‚Äù like a tree.

original: ji ltar dal ba la sogs pa gcig kyang shing gi rigs dang ldan pas shing du brjod pa de bzhin khyim gcig la yang phreng bar brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar dal ba la sogs pa gcig kyang shing gi rigs dang ldan pas shing du brjod pa de bzhin khyim gcig la yang phreng bar brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as even one tree, because it possesses the type of tree, is called a tree, in the same way, even one house would be called a garland,

original: rigs ni re re la yang tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni re re la yang tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the type is the reason for the conventional term.

original: ci ste phreng ba ni dbyibs kyi khyad par yin te /üîΩphyogs gcig tu mngon du phyin par gnas pa'i dngos po ni phreng ba'i @239a * //
analyzed: ci ste phreng ba ni dbyibs kyi khyad par yin te / phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyin par gnas pa'i dngos po ni phreng ba'i @239a * //
translated: But if a garland is a particular shape,

original: tha snyad brten pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad brten pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then an object that is arranged in a line and remains in one place is the basis for the convention ‚Äúgarland.‚Äù

original: dbyibs de yang rdzas la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs de yang rdzas la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That shape is not different from substance, etc.,üîΩbecause it is not perceived apart from them.

original: de ltar khas len na tshig gi don bdun pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas len na tshig gi don bdun pa gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you accept that, then the seventh case, the dative, would be implied.

original: de'i nang du 'dus pa la ni nyes pa brjod zin to //
analyzed: de'i nang du 'dus pa la ni nyes pa brjod zin to //
translated: And we have already explained the error in accepting that.

original: gal te phreng ba rigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phreng ba rigs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a garland is a substance,

original: de'i tshe phreng ba mang po la /
analyzed: de'i tshe phreng ba mang po la /
translated: then in a garland of many flowers,

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: the word ‚Äúthis‚Äù

original: phreng ba'o zhes de yi sgra //üîΩji ltar rigs la rigs med phyir //
analyzed: phreng ba'o zhes de yi sgra // ji ltar rigs la rigs med phyir //
translated: would refer to a single flower.üîΩBut that is not the case,

original: rigs la ni rigs khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs la ni rigs khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: because a substance does not have a universal.

original: khas len na yang de la yang rigs so zhes nye bar bsnyad pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: khas len na yang de la yang rigs so zhes nye bar bsnyad pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If you accept that, then you would have to state the reason why it is that a universal is not accepted to belong to a universal.

original: rigs rgyu mtshan yin na ni /
analyzed: rigs rgyu mtshan yin na ni /
translated: If a universal were the reason for the designation of a substance,

original: de la yang rigs gzhan yod par 'gyur bar mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: de la yang rigs gzhan yod par 'gyur bar mi 'thad do ;
translated: then it would be untenable for there to be another universal belonging to it.

original: /'di ltar phreng ba la sogs pa la phreng ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po nyid kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ji ltar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: /'di ltar phreng ba la sogs pa la phreng ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po nyid kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ji ltar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: In that case, how could there be the designation of ‚Äúgreat‚Äù in relation to a garland and so on, as in ‚Äúa great garland‚Äù?

original: yon tan chen po nyid ni rdzas la 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan chen po nyid ni rdzas la 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the quality of greatness belongs to a substance.

original: phreng ba la sogs pa ni rdzas ma yin no //
analyzed: phreng ba la sogs pa ni rdzas ma yin no //
translated: A rosary, etc., is not a substance.

original: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is a designation.

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩ'di ltar / phreng sogs la ni chen po sogs //
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / 'di ltar / phreng sogs la ni chen po sogs //
translated: This is not correct.üîΩFor,üîΩThe designation of largeness, etc.,

original: nyer btags las 'dod gang yin pa //üîΩdngos dang khyad med rnams shes kyi //
analyzed: nyer btags las 'dod gang yin pa // dngos dang khyad med rnams shes kyi //
translated: in a rosary, etc.,üîΩis not recognized as different

original: gzung bya yin phyir nyer btags min //
analyzed: gzung bya yin phyir nyer btags min //
translated: from the substance, because it is apprehended.

original: phreng ba la sogs pa dag la chen po nyid nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: phreng ba la sogs pa dag la chen po nyid nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How do you know that the designation of largeness, etc., is in a rosary, etc.?

original: 'di nye bar btags pa nyid du rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di nye bar btags pa nyid du rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: There is no recognition of this as a mere designation.

original: de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa la ni de ltar khas blang bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa la ni de ltar khas blang bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: And if there is no such recognition, it cannot be accepted that way,

original: khas len pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the acceptance is based on the recognition.

original: chen po nyid don gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chen po nyid don gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because largeness is not a different object.

original: de med pa nyid ga las med par grub na de'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin la nye bar btags pa yin pa na yang med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa nyid ga las med par grub na de'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin la nye bar btags pa yin pa na yang med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were established that it does not exist, then it would be a mere designation. And if it were a mere designation, it would not exist.

original: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: This is the error of mutual dependence.

original: rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid rdzas kyi chos ni phreng ba'i ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid rdzas kyi chos ni phreng ba'i ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is not a substance, and greatness is a quality of a substance, not of a string.

original: rdzas ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not established that it is not a substance.

original: bya ba dang yon tan can 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir rdzas kyi mtshan nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang yon tan can 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir rdzas kyi mtshan nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the combination of action and the possessor of a quality is a substance, so the definition of substance exists.

original: bya ba can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhen ma yin te /
translated: No, because it is not the possessor of action.

original: bsdus pa ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because combination is not a definition.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Space, etc. are not the possessors of action.

original: la lar ni bya ba can la sogs pa bsdus pa mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: la lar ni bya ba can la sogs pa bsdus pa mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: In some cases, the definition is the combination of the possessor of action, etc.

original: la lar ni 'ga' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar ni 'ga' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In some cases, it is something else.

original: gal te rnam par dpyad na chen po nyid don dam par med pa'i phyir rdzas ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dpyad na chen po nyid don dam par med pa'i phyir rdzas ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you analyze, it is not a substance because the state of being great does not exist ultimately.

original: rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir med do @239b zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir med do @239b zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: Where is it said that it does not exist because it is not realized?

original: rtogs pa ni gtso bor 'gyur ba las med par grub na de'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin la nye phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni gtso bor 'gyur ba las med par grub na de'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin la nye phyir ro //
translated: If it is established that it does not exist due to the transformation of realization, then it is a mere designation because it is close to that.

original: gal te gtso bo dang khyad par med pa can yang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid yin na ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gtso bo dang khyad par med pa can yang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid yin na ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which is not different from the primal substance is not the primal substance, then the primal substance would not be differentiated.

original: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad ni gtso bo yin pa'am /
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad ni gtso bo yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference, everything is the primal substance,

original: yang na 'ga' yang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'ga' yang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: or else nothing is the primal substance. This is logical.

original: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs gzhan gyi rdzas la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa byas ba 'di ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs gzhan gyi rdzas la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa byas ba 'di ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this arrangement of a garland and so on as another substance and so on is not good.

original: phreng ba zhes pa shing la sogs pa las tha dad ba ni cung zad kyang dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: phreng ba zhes pa shing la sogs pa las tha dad ba ni cung zad kyang dmigs pa med de /
translated: A rosary is not perceived as anything different from the beads, etc.

original: 'di ni gnas pa'i khyad par las rtogs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa'i khyad par las rtogs pa tsam yin no //
translated: It is merely a conceptual distinction based on a particular arrangement of the beads.

original: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs pa la chen po la sogs pa'i sgra ni nye bar btags pa ma yin zhing gtso bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phreng ba la sogs pa la chen po la sogs pa'i sgra ni nye bar btags pa ma yin zhing gtso bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the terms ‚Äúlarge,‚Äù etc., in reference to a rosary, etc., are not metaphorical, nor are they primary.

original: re zhig gtso bo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gtso bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not primary,

original: rgyu mtshan don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other object that is the reason for the term.

original: nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not metaphorical either,

original: nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na me tog rgyas pa'i nags zhes don gcig la 'du ba las nags la me tog rgyas par nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro // dper na me tog rgyas pa'i nags zhes don gcig la 'du ba las nags la me tog rgyas par nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: because there is no reason for a metaphor.

original: nags dang me tog rgyas pa dag ni shing rnams la 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags dang me tog rgyas pa dag ni shing rnams la 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, in the expression ‚Äúa forest in full bloom,‚Äù the term ‚Äúin full bloom‚Äù is a metaphor for the forest, because the flowers and the forest are the same in that they are both collections of trees.

original: dngos su mngon par 'dod pa la'ang //
analyzed: dngos su mngon par 'dod pa la'ang //
translated: The primary object of reference is the same in both cases.üîΩThe reason is the same in both cases,

original: rgyu gzhan min pa nyid de mtshungs //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan min pa nyid de mtshungs //
translated: because there is no other cause.

original: drug rnams la ni tshig don sgra //
analyzed: drug rnams la ni tshig don sgra //
translated: The terms ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù and so on are applied to the six categories in dependence on other causes.

original: rgyu gzhan gang la ltos par mthong //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang la ltos par mthong //
translated: What other causes are seen?

original: rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa ni gtso bo yin la rgyu gzhan med pa ni phal ba yin no zhes gang bshad pa de ni srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dang ldan pa ni gtso bo yin la rgyu gzhan med pa ni phal ba yin no zhes gang bshad pa de ni srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that that which possesses other causes is primary and that which does not possess other causes is secondary.

original: gang gi phyir dbyig pa can zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gtso bor mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag la yang rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbyig pa can zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gtso bor mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag la yang rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because even those things that are accepted as primary, such as the one who holds the club, do not possess other causes.

original: dbyig pa can la sogs pa yang kun rdzob pa nyid do zhes da ltar kho na bshad pa yin no //üîΩdrug po rnams la tshig gi don gyi sgra 'jug pa yang rgyu gzhan gang zhig la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: dbyig pa can la sogs pa yang kun rdzob pa nyid do zhes da ltar kho na bshad pa yin no // drug po rnams la tshig gi don gyi sgra 'jug pa yang rgyu gzhan gang zhig la ltos pa yin /
translated: We have already explained that the one who holds the club and so on are conventional.üîΩThe terms ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù and so on are applied to the six categories in dependence on other causes.

original: rdzas la sogs pa 'jug pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa nyid dbang med du 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa 'jug pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa nyid dbang med du 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: When the terms ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù and so on are applied, the very essence of the thing is applied. The definition of the essence of a thing is that it is not dependent on another cause.

original: ci ste rgyu mtshan med par 'jug pa'i tshig gi don gyi sgra de ni de gtso bor zhes bya bar rigs pa yin gyi //
analyzed: ci ste rgyu mtshan med par 'jug pa'i tshig gi don gyi sgra de ni de gtso bor zhes bya bar rigs pa yin gyi //
translated: If you say that the word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù is used to refer to the sound that is applied without reason,

original: chen po la sogs pa'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yon tan rgyu mtshan can yin pas /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yon tan rgyu mtshan can yin pas /
translated: then the words ‚Äúgreat‚Äù and so on would be used to refer to the sound that is applied on the basis of a reason.

original: gang la rgyu mtshan med par 'jug pa de la gdon mi za bar phal pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la rgyu mtshan med par 'jug pa de la gdon mi za bar phal pa yin no //
translated: But the sound that is applied without reason is definitely not primary.

original: de'i phyir don yod pa ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don yod pa ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: Therefore, the existent object is primary,

original: gzhan ni @240a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni @240a * //
translated: and the other is

original: phal pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phal pa yin no zhe na /
translated: secondary.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: This is also not tenable.

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar grags las grub gang yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar grags las grub gang yin //
translated: Why? Because it is established from what is renowned:

original: dngos dang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos dang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is real and similar to that,

original: gang la de skad brjod phal pa //
analyzed: gang la de skad brjod phal pa //
translated: the word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù is applied to that.

original: dngos la'ang dngos med btags phyir ro /
analyzed: dngos la'ang dngos med btags phyir ro /
translated: But the word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù is also applied to the real, because the unreal is imputed to the real.

original: rgyu mtshan yod dam gzhan du rung ste grags pa las gzhan du'ang 'jug pa ni gtso bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yod dam gzhan du rung ste grags pa las gzhan du'ang 'jug pa ni gtso bo nyid yin la /
translated: Whether or not there is a reason, if it is applied in a way that is different from what is renowned, it is primary.

original: de dang mtshungs pa la ltos nas gang du de ltar 'jug pa de la ni gtso bo ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa la ltos nas gang du de ltar 'jug pa de la ni gtso bo ma yin pa yin te /
translated: In contrast, that which is not primary is that in which the word is used in a secondary sense.

original: bu la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang med pa nye bar btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdon yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bu la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang med pa nye bar btags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // don yod pa nyid dam /
translated: For we see that the word is applied in a secondary sense to things such as sons.

original: gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: The primary meaning is either the real object or another word.

original: gtso bo nyid kyi rgyu ni grags pa kho na yi na ni //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyi rgyu ni grags pa kho na yi na ni //
translated: The reason for the primary meaning is simply the well-known meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na phyin ci log tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phyin ci log tu mthong ngo //
translated: Otherwise, the word would be seen to be used in the opposite sense.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba na nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //üîΩtshig gi don gyi sgra rgyu mtshan med pa nyid de ni de kho na ltar gtso bor gyur pa yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba na nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no // tshig gi don gyi sgra rgyu mtshan med pa nyid de ni de kho na ltar gtso bor gyur pa yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: The word is used in a secondary sense when there is no real reason.üîΩThe word is used in a primary sense when the reason is real.üîΩIf that were not so, the word would be seen to be used in the opposite sense.

original: 'o na rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dngos kyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dngos kyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the word is used in a secondary sense when there is no real reason, then the word with a real reason would not be the primary cause.

original: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists even when that does not exist.

original: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: That which occurs even when something does not exist is not the reason for that.üîΩIf the word with a real reason is not the primary cause, then the word without a real reason would be the primary cause.üîΩBut that is not so.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bus ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bus ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause and effect are characterized by the forward and reverse processes.

original: rgyu mtshan ni rgyu yin la rgyu mtshan can ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni rgyu yin la rgyu mtshan can ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The cause is the reason, and the effect is that which has the reason.

original: gal te grags pa de nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med par ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grags pa de nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med par ji lta zhe na /
translated: If the meaning of the word is the reason for the application of the word, how can it be that the meaning is not the reason for the application of the word?

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / grags pa brda yi rjes 'gro can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / grags pa brda yi rjes 'gro can //
translated: The meaning of the word is the object of the word.

original: de yang brjod 'dod rjes 'gro can //
analyzed: de yang brjod 'dod rjes 'gro can //
translated: That is also related to the desire to speak.

original: tha snyad don du byas pa'ang ste //
analyzed: tha snyad don du byas pa'ang ste //
translated: It is also the object of the convention.

original: sdeb sbyor ming dang sgra cha bzhin //
analyzed: sdeb sbyor ming dang sgra cha bzhin //
translated: It is like the name and the part of the word.

original: gang la brda zhugs pa de ni grags pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: gang la brda zhugs pa de ni grags pa'i don yin la /
translated: The object of the word is the object of the word that is the object of the word.

original: brda yang smra ba po'i 'dod pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: brda yang smra ba po'i 'dod pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: That is also related to the desire to speak.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the reason for the application of the word exists,

original: smra ba'i 'dod pa med par sgra 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba'i 'dod pa med par sgra 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the application of the word is not without the desire to speak.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med kyang 'dod pas 'jug pa ni mthong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med kyang 'dod pas 'jug pa ni mthong ba kho na ste /
translated: Even without a reason for the application, the application through desire is seen.

original: dper na skyes bu la seng ge la sogs pa ming 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la seng ge la sogs pa ming 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a person is called a lion.

original: des na 'dod pa la rang dbang du gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'dod pa la rang dbang du gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of being independent with regard to desire,

original: de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that that is the reason for the application of the term.

original: de nyid rgyu mtshan med par ci'i phyir brda'i sgo nas sgra 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu mtshan med par ci'i phyir brda'i sgo nas sgra 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one apply a term by way of a sign that is without a reason?

original: rgyu mtshan la yang ci'i phyir 'jug / tha snyad kyi don du'o zhe na tha snyad de ni 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med kyang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan la yang ci'i phyir 'jug / tha snyad kyi don du'o zhe na tha snyad de ni 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan med kyang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is for the sake of conventional objects, that convention is the same even if there is no reason for application.

original: tha snyad kyang don byed pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyang don byed pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Convention is also the domain of the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa don byed pa med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa don byed pa med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that that which is without a reason does not perform a function.

original: rgyu mtshan med na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no reason, it will not be so.

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs med par don byed par @240b nus pa ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs med par don byed par @240b nus pa ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the performance of an object‚Äôs function is possible without a reason such as a Brahmin.

original: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no valid cognition of that.

original: rigs 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ni med do //
analyzed: rigs 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ni med do //
translated: But there is no valid cognition that would establish that there are some universals.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rang bzhin ji snyed cig nus par mthong ba de tsam kho na cig nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rang bzhin ji snyed cig nus par mthong ba de tsam kho na cig nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to say that only that much is called ‚Äúhaving the property of being related to the application‚Äù as is seen to be capable of having the property of being related to the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan med kyang tha snyad kyi don du brda byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan med kyang tha snyad kyi don du brda byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, even without a reason, one can make a convention for the sake of a nominal object.

original: dper na sdeb sbyor dang sgra la phreng ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i ming dang rang bzhin la sogs par brda ra btags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sdeb sbyor dang sgra la phreng ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i ming dang rang bzhin la sogs par brda ra btags pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the convention of calling a person who holds a rosary a ‚Äúrosary holder‚Äù and so on.

original: de la ni rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, there is no reason at all.

original: phreng ba 'dzin pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phreng ba 'dzin pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because ‚Äúrosary holder‚Äù and so on are understood in any way one wishes.

original: yi ge'i rim pa la ni rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge'i rim pa la ni rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of the order of the letters, there is not even the slightest reason.

original: de lta ma yin na brda ma bzung bas kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na brda ma bzung bas kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that one would understand the meaning even without having apprehended the sign.

original: gang zhig rtogs pa yod pa de la brda ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs pa yod pa de la brda ci zhig bya /
translated: What use is a sign to one who already understands?

original: brda gsal bar byed do zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: brda gsal bar byed do zhen ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the sign makes the meaning clear, then that is not so,

original: rtogs pa med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no understanding, then there is no meaning.

original: ma rtogs pa la ni brda yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la ni brda yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if there is no understanding, then there is no sign.

original: brda nyid kyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: brda nyid kyis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sign itself makes one understand,

original: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i nyes bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the fault of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: ji srid dngos po mthong med par //
analyzed: ji srid dngos po mthong med par //
